jx.jx_en_mean: From one place to another; hither and thither.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 到处：从一处到另一处；来来往往

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French piler, based on Latin pila 'pillar'

entry.def: A pillar is a tall solid structure, which is usually used to support part of a building.
If something is the pillar of a system or agreement, it is the most important part of it or what makes it strong and successful.

example.ex: The pillar of her economic policy was keeping tight control over money supply.
example.tran: 她经济政策的核心是严格控制货币的供应。
种族隔离制最后的支柱

entry.def: If you describe someone as a pillar of society or as a pillar of the community, you approve of them because they play an important and active part in society or in the community.

example.ex: My father had been a pillar of the community.
example.tran: 我父亲一直是社区的顶梁柱。

means.word_mean: 2. anything tall and thin approximating the shape of a column or tower;

sentences.sentence: "the test tube held a column of white powder"
"a tower of dust rose above the horizon"
"a thin pillar of smoke betrayed their campsite"
"he is a pillar of the community"

means.word_mean: 4. a vertical structure standing alone and not supporting anything (as a monument or a column of air)
5. (architeture) a tall cylindrical vertical upright and used to support a structure
